Package ohos.telephony

Class ShortMessageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.telephony.ShortMessageManager

  • public class ShortMessageManager
extends Object
    Provides the capabilities and methods for obtaining Short Message Service (SMS) management objects.

    This class is a singleton class. Applications can use the getInstance method to obtain an instance and then use the instance to invoke the methods to manage SMS operations, for example, sending SMS messages or checking whether a device supports SMS.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ShortMessageManager getInstance​(Context context)
        Obtains an instance of ShortMessageManager.

        If the ID of the default SIM card used for sending SMS messages changes, the ShortMessageManager instance changes accordingly. You can obtain the default SIM card by using getDefaultSmsSlotId.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context of the application to invoke.
        Returns:
        Returns an instance of ShortMessageManager.
        Since:
        1

      • getDefaultSmsSlotId

        public int getDefaultSmsSlotId​()
        Obtains the default SIM card for sending SMS messages.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the default SIM card for sending SMS messages is in card slot 1; returns 1 if the default SIM card for sending SMS messages is in card slot 2.
        Since:
        1

      • hasSmsCapability

        public boolean hasSmsCapability​()
        Returns whether a device is capable of sending and receiving SMS messages.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the device is capable of sending and receiving SMS messages; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • splitMessage

        public ArrayList<String> splitMessage​(String content)
        Splits a long SMS message into multiple fragments.

        If the length of an SMS message exceeds the maximum length allowed (140 bytes), the SMS message is split into multiple segments for processing.

        Applications must have the SystemPermission.SEND_MESSAGES permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        content - Indicates the short message content, which cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of split segments, which can be combined into a complete SMS message; returns an empty string if no permission is granted or the short message content is null.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        sendMessage(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,ohos.telephony.ISendShortMessageCallback,ohos.telephony.IDeliveryShortMessageCallback)

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(int slotId,
                        String destinationHost,
                        String serviceCenter,
                        String content,
                        ISendShortMessageCallback sendCallback,
                        IDeliveryShortMessageCallback deliveryCallback)
        Sends a text SMS message.

        This method checks whether the length of an SMS message exceeds the maximum length. If the maximum length is exceeded, the SMS message is split into multiple parts and sent separately.

        You need to obtain the following permission before calling this method: SystemPermission.SEND_MESSAGES

        Parameters:
        slotId - Indicates the ID of the SIM card slot used for sending the SMS message.
        destinationHost - Indicates the address to which the SMS message is sent.
        serviceCenter - Indicates the short message service center (SMSC) address. If the value is null, the default SMSC address of the SIM card is used.
        content - Indicates the content of the SMS message. If the length of the content exceeds the maximum length, this SMS message is split into multiple parts.
        sendCallback - Indicates the callback invoked after the SMS message is sent.
        deliveryCallback - Indicates the callback invoked after the SMS message is delivered.
        Since:
        4

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(int slotId,
                        String destinationHost,
                        String serviceCenter,
                        byte[] data,
                        short destinationPort,
                        ISendShortMessageCallback sendCallback,
                        IDeliveryShortMessageCallback deliveryCallback)
        Sends a data SMS message.

        You need to obtain the following permission before calling this method: SystemPermission.SEND_MESSAGES

        Parameters:
        slotId - Indicates the ID of the SIM card slot used for sending the SMS message.
        destinationHost - Indicates the address to which the SMS message is sent.
        serviceCenter - Indicates the SMSC address. If the value is null, the default SMSC address of the SIM card is used.
        data - Indicates the content of the SMS message.
        destinationPort - Indicates the destination port for sending the SMS message.
        sendCallback - Indicates the callback invoked after the SMS message is sent.
        deliveryCallback - Indicates the callback invoked after the SMS message is delivered.
        Since:
        4
